title: The Lotus in Eastern Religion
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Lotus in Eastern Religion.

hook.text: The lotus grows from mud, rises through water, and blooms in sun. Every major Asian religion reads it as metaphor.

buildup.text: In Buddhism, the lotus means enlightenmentâ€”rising from suffering (mud) through practice (water) to awakening.

discovery.text: In Hinduism, gods sit on lotus thrones. Lakshmi emerges from a lotus. Vishnu holds one.

twist.text: Lotus leaves repel water perfectlyâ€”the 'lotus effect.' Scientists copied this for self-cleaning surfaces.

climax.text: The lotus is simultaneously sacred symbol, medicinal plant, food source, and engineering inspiration.

punchline.text: One flower inspired religions, recipes, and nanotechnology.

quiz.question: What is the 'lotus effect' that scientists have copied for technology?
options: The ability to bloom in complete darkness without sunlight
Water-repelling leaf surfaces that enable self-cleaning coatings
The fragrance that attracts pollinators from miles away
